column2: Unorganized and decentralized, Non-Denominational Christians are marked by diverse practices, ranging from charismatic worship to minimalist gatherings, where believers emphasize scripture over dogma. However, its lack of cohesion has left it vulnerable to internal schisms and outside condemnation. Reforming the Non-Denominational Christian Heresy could bring unity to its scattered followers, potentially transforming it into a powerful spiritual force, guided by a codified theology that bridges its many disparate beliefs.
The [TrexNewHeresy] faith is a new branch of Christianity.
We should be careful about who becomes the leader of our faith.
